title: Shinto Shrine

adjectives: Relating to or characteristic of Shintoism
nouns: A shrine is a holy or sacred place, which is dedicated to a specific deity, ancestor, hero, martyr, saint, daemon or similar figure of awe and respect, at which they are venerated or worshipped.

Holy or sacred place, which is dedicated to a specific deity

description:
A shrine used for the Japanese Shinto religion. This emoji generally displays the torii, which is the gate to the Shinto Shrine. The torii is generally a red colored structure, with a curved roof section above two posts.

This icon is used on maps in Japan to represent the location of a Shinto Shrine, similar to how the hot springs emoji is the icon used on Japanese maps to show the location of an onsen.
apple_vendor_description: Apple’s shinto shrine emoji is rendered with meticulous detail, presenting a vibrant vermillion structure with a gently curved, dark roof, characteristic of traditional Japanese architecture. On Apple devices, the glossy 3D shading and soft lighting bring the miniature temple to life, evoking a sense of peace, spirituality, and cultural significance. It’s often used to signify travel to Japan, a connection to nature, or a moment of reflection and reverence in digital conversations.
